III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When youth resided at the facility, they were sexually assaulted by
a staff member.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was completed with
Compliance at Vista Maria. The DHHS Specialist was also
present. Compliance was advised of the allegations of the special
investigation. He was advised that no specific staff had been
identified at this time. Compliance advised that Youth A is no
longer placed with the agency and was discharged in November
2023. A request was made for any incident reports involving
Youth A and allegations of sexual abuse. Compliance advised
there will be no video footage available as the alleged incident is
from over two years ago. A request was also made for a list of
staff that were employed with the agency at that time.
Compliance agreed to provide all available information but also
advised that due to staff turnover there may not be many staff that
are still employed with the agency from 2022 – 2023.
On 12/10/2024 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call with any additional concerns.
On 12/19/2024 an interview was completed with Compliance at
Vista Maria. The DHHS Specialist was also present. Compliance
advised that there are currently no incident reports that allege
sexual abuse of Youth A. He also advised there are no youth
currently at the facility that were present when Youth A was there
or during the alleged time frame or any staff that are currently
working at Freedom Center that were working there in 2022/2023.
He lastly advised that there is no documentation of any staff or
youth disclosing concerns with Youth A being sexually abused.
On 12/23/2024 an interview was completed with Compliance at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Compliance
advised that one staff has been identified as a potential male staff
working at Freedom Center during that time. He is no longer
employed with the agency, but was identified as Staff 1.
2

On 12/23/2024 an interview was completed with Staff 2 at Vista
Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 2 was not
employed with Vista Maria during 2022 and 2023. Due to staff
turnover and lack of availability of staff from 2022/2023, current
Vista Maria staff was interviewed. Staff 2 denied any knowledge
of reports of inappropriate behavior, including sexual abuse, being
reported by any youth or staff at Vista Maria. Staff 2 reported
vaguely recalling working with Staff 1 and had no concerns
regarding his interaction with youth at the facility.
On 12/23/2024 an interview was completed with Youth B and
Youth C at Vista Maria. Both youth denied any concerns with
inappropriate sexual behavior by staff at Vista Maria.
On 01/08/2025 an in-person interview was held with Staff 3 at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 3 was not
employed with Vista Maria during 2022 and 2023. Due to staff
turnover and lack of availability of staff from 2022/2023, current
Vista Maria staff was interviewed. He denied any knowledge of
any staff being sexually inappropriate with youth at the facility. He
denied that any such behavior has been reported to him.
On 02/05/2025 a voicemail message was left for FCW requesting
a return call with any concerns regarding Youth A and placement
at Vista Maria.
On 02/07/2025 a telephone conversation was held with DHHS
Specialist. She advised that CAC interview of Youth A would be
rescheduled due to miscommunication of date and location with
agency staff. She also advised that review of DHHS history does
not document any concerns relative to sexual or physical abuse
for Staff 1.
On 02/12/2025 a video conference interview was held with Youth
A. DHHS Specialist and CAC interviewer were also present.
Youth A recalled her previous placement at Vista Maria. She
reported that one day she was upset and advised staff that she
had plans to self-harm. She reported she had her MP3 player and
staff were concerned that she would try strangling herself with the
cord and requested that she provide the MP3 player to them.
Youth A stated that she refused to provide it and placed the MP3
player in her bra. She recalled that Staff 1 put his hand down her
shirt to obtain the MP3 player. She stated that other staff were
present when this occurred but could not recall names. Youth A
stated that Staff 1 did touch her when this occurred, but it was not
sexual in nature. She did not believe Staff 1 was being “malicious
3

or had intent to sexually abuse her”. Youth A denied any other
incidents of inappropriate sexual behavior by staff while she was
placed at the facility. She also denied knowledge of any incidents
involving other youth.
On 02/19/2025 an interview of Youth D was completed at Vista
Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth D reported that
male staff are appropriate and denied that she has ever seen any
male staff being inappropriate with youth at the facility. She also
denied that any other youth or staff have disclosed any such
incidents have occurred. She reported feeling safe at the agency.
On 02/20/2025 and 02/21/2025 a telephone call was made to
Staff 1. A voicemail message was left requesting a return call.
To date, no response has been received. The number provided
was the last known contact number on file from the agency.
On 02/20/2025 a DHHS Case Conference was held. DHHS
specialist advised that there are no findings relative to her case.
She also advised that law enforcement would be closing their
case as no disclosures were made. Assigned FCW participated in
the case conference and reported that she was aware of incident
involving MP3 player and no sexual abuse concerns were noted
regarding the incident at that time.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy - In order to promote
acceptable behavior at Vista Maria, employees are expected to
conduct themselves in a positive, professional and respectful
manner at all times in order to promote the therapeutic alliance
between the employee and the clients who are assigned into the
care of Vista Maria". The document indicates that Vista Maria
employee prohibited behaviors includes: "Engaging in any form of
sexual or other forms of harassing or bullying behavior", "abuse,
neglect or mismanagement of clients, co worker or visitor",
"immoral, violent or indecent conduct on Vista Maria property",
"giving or receiving gifts/items of value to or from clients without
immediate supervisor approval".
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Interviews of both staff and
youth were completed and there was not sufficient evidence to
support non-compliance by the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
